alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 12:08AM CDT until July 21 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Anderson County in east Tennessee... West Central Knox County in east Tennessee... * Until 300 AM EDT. * At 108 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen over the last 6 hours, with moderate to heavy rain continuing over parts of the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Karns and Powell. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
